Authors: Saroso H., Hamzah O., Warsono W., Soekarso S., Ishak R.M.
Title: The role of advertising and raw material in pharmaceutical company
Source title: International Journal of Innovation, Creativity and Change
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Saroso, H., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hamzah, O., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Warsono, W., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Soekarso, S., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ishak, R.M., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Companies are always faced with performance targets that rely on the ability and quality of their resources. Not many studies have evaluated the characteristics of company resources that form business models so that they can winagainst competition. Pharmaceutical companies are no exception. Not all of the investments that have been allocated in company activities have a high impact. In this research, we want to test which resources have the most dominant influence on company performance, especially in the pharmaceutical industry. The variables studied were the levels of investment in the company, raw materials, advertising, training, and the number of workers on company performance. The data used are secondary longitudinal data from 5 pharmaceutical companies listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange. The results of this study indicate that advertising has the most potent influence on company performance in the pharmaceutical industry. These findings contradict the perception that pharmaceutical companies must prioritise raw materials. © 2019, Primrose Hall Publishing Group.
Author Keywords: Advertising; Investment; Performance; Pharmaceutical; Raw material; Resource-based theory; Training
